title: Dynamic Mode Decomposition: Recognition of Spatio-Temporal Patterns in Large-Scale Neural Recordings for Imagination and Movement Tasks
description: Neural recordings are essential for investigating the nervous system. Although they typically generate data in a high-dimensional space, their underlying structure often lies in a low-dimensional one. Dynamic Mode Decomposition (DMD) is used to construct reduced-order representations of these data, enabling extraction of meaningful spatio-temporal patterns from large-scale neural recordings.

details.challenge: Extracting interpretable spatio-temporal features from complex, high-dimensional neural recordings with minimal loss of information.
details.solution: Applied Dynamic Mode Decomposition to neural datasets to obtain low-dimensional modes representing key spatial and temporal dynamics relevant for imagination and movement tasks.
